metadata.Title: CVE-2020-29129 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
ncsi.c in libslirp through 4.3.1 has a buffer over-read because it tries to read a certain amount of header data even if that exceeds the total packet length.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-29129` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libslirp0 - 4.4.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libslirp package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1').
